title: Language Simulation Learning Design Utilizing Nonlinear Pedagogy

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Digital Device Operation Skills and Elementary-Level Language Comprehension
context.additional_context: Learners simulate office/administrative roles in a VR environment, applying nonlinear instructional methods during language task resolution. Personal device (BYOD)-enabled customized learning environments are implemented.

learning_goals: Learners solve nonlinear tasks (e.g., situational language selection) presented in simulation environments with ≥80% accuracy
Through collaboration in VR role-playing, learners achieve ≥3.5 on a 4-point Likert scale for autonomy and competency during problem-solving processes
Formative assessments (weekly quizzes/feedback) advance learners’ language application skills by ≥2 stages in a 3-level growth model (basic → applied → creative utilization)
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
